conclusion: Understanding the graph with reciprocal of velocity plotted against displacement.
Understanding what reciprocal of velocity represents.
Considering the relationship between velocity and displacement.
Trying to relate acceleration to the graph.
Using chain rule to relate derivatives: dy/dx = - (1/v^2) * dv/dx.
Expressing velocity in terms of displacement and time.
1/v is the derivative of time with respect to displacement.
If 1/v against x is a straight line, then dy/dx = constant.
Relating dv/dx to dv/dt using chain rule: dv/dt = dv/dx * v.
Considering specific examples of constant acceleration.
Using equation v^2 = u^2 + 2as to express v in terms of x.
1/v = 1/sqrt(u^2 + 2as) results in a curve, not a straight line.
Line is increasing, so m is positive, confirming deceleration.
